lines.text: People throw stones.  They call me names.  I mean, really.

lines.text: Jesus.  Data-base hoods.  It's a wonderful world.  Beloved daughter missing.  Reward of two hundred and fifty thousand dollars. Please find our adored angel, we miss her so.  Dead or alive.

lines.text: Since Mary Clarence came to St. Katherine's, I've been shot at, kidnapped by Mafia hit men, and I've tasted beer. Is that enough experience yet?  For final vows?

lines.text: But, Bishop, surely you realize -- this is a most dangerous neighborhood.

lines.speaker: u7638
lines.text: And you'll face that danger head-on.  As if I could stop you.  And you have my complete support in this matter. Anything you can do to revitalize this neighborhood would be a blessing.

lines.text: Clergyman Steenwyck is calling a meeting.  This time he is determined to have you forced out, or worse.

lines.speaker: u7643
lines.text: He came to me.  He promised great violence.  Said I should cast you out for my own protection.  I must speak honestly.  There is no reason to think he will not meet with success.

lines.speaker: u7646
lines.text: You cannot do this.  I am a man of God!

lines.speaker: u7649

lines.speaker: u7647

lines.speaker: u7648
lines.text: There is a farming community upstate, Constable... ten days journey north in the Hudson Highlands.  It is named Sleepy Hollow.  Within a fortnight, three persons have been murdered there. Each with their head lopped cleanly off.  The elders of the Hollow have sent dispatches to me, requesting assistance, and now, just this very moment, I have chosen you.

lines.speaker: u7649
lines.text: Chosen me?

lines.speaker: u7648
lines.text: These "methods" of yours... there has been no practical application.

lines.speaker: u7649

lines.speaker: u7648
lines.text: Just so.  Granted.  And so you take your experimentations to Sleepy Hollow and catch the murderer who has tainted the place.  Bring him here to face our good justice. Will you do this for me?

lines.speaker: u7649
lines.text: I shall, gladly.

lines.speaker: u7648
lines.text: Excellent.  Then, you are excused till morning.

lines.speaker: u7649
lines.text: What... what are you doing?

lines.speaker: u7653

lines.speaker: u7652
lines.text: Imagine my surprise, finding him on a liason with a common servant.  A girl who had apparently become his secret love.

lines.speaker: u7650
lines.text: No one will believe your lies, whore.

lines.speaker: u7652

lines.text: ... on the third day I washed her. She wasn't very clean. I got all the right spots. She was the first one I ever kept for any length of time, you see I get bored easily, I have a short attention span. I can't say she enjoyed her stay, although the washcloth in her mouth held in place by good duct tape kept any complaints to a minimum. I don't really like people who talk a lot. I like to do the talking. I guess that's why I'm so fond of you. You're so easygoing, although I do sense a little tension in you sometimes. By the way, how was it out there? Did you have any fun? Make any new acquaintances? Tell me what it was like.

lines.speaker: u7666
lines.text: They was a boy. We made friends.

lines.text: Well, it's not too big in here, is it?  I feel very generous today. I feel like listening. I'm sure you have plenty to tell me. And please bore me with the details.  ) Come on Karl, who did you kill? Was it the boy?

lines.text: I told you to get away from here, didn't I? I'm tryin' to relax and look at TV.  What are you doin' with that piece of iron? I swear to God you're the weirdest son of a bitch I ever heard of.

lines.text: What about you, Karl? Do you want to stay here?

lines.speaker: u7666
lines.text: I don't reckon you have to go with women to be a daddy to a boy.  You've been real square dealin' with me. The Bible says two men ort not lay together. But I'll bet you the Good Lord wouldn't send nobody like you to Hades. Some folks calls it Hell, I call it Hades.  That boy lives inside of his own heart. Hits an awful big place. You take care of that boy.

lines.speaker: u7673
lines.text: Listen everybody, I know this may sound corny, I've had a few glasses of wine and that kind of makes me a little emotional, but I'm going to say it anyway. It just came over me in a rush. I want you all to know that I care about each and every one of you at this table.

lines.text: That's very sweet of you Vaughan. We care about you, too. Don't we y'all?

lines.speaker: u7673

lines.text: They don't come cheap, son. These little honeys are works of art. Rolled by hand in a tropical climate, most likely by an eighteen year old girl in a thin cotton dress with no underwear on. Little beads of sweat forming in her naked cleavage. The smooth, delicate fingers nimbly turning out one masterpiece after another...

lines.speaker: u7677
lines.text: His father walked out on his mother a couple of months after he was born. Louisa was Henry's younger sister, and she and the baby moved in with us. Four or five years go by, and then one day Cyrus shows up out of the blue, tail between his legs, wanting to patch things up with Louisa. I thought Henry was going to tear Cyrus apart when he saw him walk through the door. They're both big men, those two, and if they ever started to tangle, you'd see some teeth jumping on the floor. I guarantee it ... So Cyrus persuaded Louisa to go out with him to talk things over in quiet. And the poor girl never came back.

lines.speaker: u7682
lines.text: You mean she just ran off with him and left her little boy behind?

lines.speaker: u7677
lines.text: Don't put words in my mouth. What I'm saying is she drove off in Cyrus's car and went to the Five-Spot Lounge with him for a drink. What I'm saying is that he imbibed too much in the way of alcohol and that when they finished their little talk three hours later and got back in the car, he was in no shape to drive. But he drove the car anyway, and before he could get her back to where she lived, the damn fool ran a red light and went straight into a truck. Louisa got thrown through the windshield and was killed. Cyrus lived, but he came out of it a cripple. His left arm was so mangled, the doctors had to cut it off. Small punishment for what he did, if you ask me.

lines.speaker: u7682
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.speaker: u7677
lines.text: Jesus had nothing to do with it. If He'd been involved. He would have seen to it that things worked out the opposite from what they did.

lines.text: It can't have been easy on him. Walking around with that on his conscience all these years.

lines.speaker: u7677
lines.text: No, I don't suppose it has. He was broken up like nobody's business in that hospital when he found out Louisa was dead.

lines.speaker: u7682
lines.text: And he's never tried to get in touch with his son?

lines.speaker: u7677
lines.text: Henry told Cyrus he'd kill him if he ever showed his face around our house again. When Henry makes a threat like that, people tend to take him seriously.

lines.speaker: u7707
lines.text: Melton, on the double!  Up a chain!                                   MELTON  Sir!     MELTON takes a few easy strides, gracefully catches a chain mid- stride, and smarts up, climbing easily and twice as fast as TODD.     CHURCH, SLOAN, and RUBRICK crane their necks as the two men struggle upward toward the rafters.     Three quarters of the way up, MELTON comes even with TODD, then passes him. MEKUM, watching, smirks.     CHURCH is watching too, and he's still not satisfied.  His brow is knit, something's bothering him.     ANGLE HIGH ABOVE, AMONG THE GIRDERS     Stonefaced, MELTON is resting an a "platform" on the chain, sixty feet up, beneath the girders, swaying gently.     His stony gaze is on the next chain where TODD is arriving at a "platform" on an adjacent chain...only three feet away.     Their eyes meet, TODD and MELTON alone together sixty feet up, three feet apart.  Neither man blinks, neither man flinches, neither man reveals anything at all...     LOW ANGLE, LOOKING UP     CHURCH considers the men high above, then to MEKUM.                                   CHURCH                    What about...spirit?

lines.speaker: u7707
lines.text: Spirit?                          Oh!  You mean "AQ"..."aggressive qualities"?

lines.speaker: u7706
lines.text: Whatever the latest jargon is.                                   MEKUM Much better, much higher.  For example, where your old ones expressed ninety percent of their sexual energy in aggressive physicality, these new ones are ninety-nine percent without sexual inclination.  It's <u>all</u> aggression.                                   SLOAN                          <u>Real</u> men!                                   CHURCH                          At ease, Lieutenant.                          What if they fought?     A sudden silence.     SLOAN raises her eyebrows, gives RUBRICK a look.     Frowning thoughtfully, MEKUM looks up. MEKUM You mean up there?                                   CHURCH                                             Go ahead, Rube.  Tell Todd to take him. MEKUM No!     They all look at MEKUM.  Is this the chink in the armor?  The new soldiers can't fight?                                   CHURCH                    "No"? MEKUM Not fair.  No contest.  Send two more of your old ones up.     Now CHURCH, RUBRICK, and SLOAN are stunned.  They exchange a glance.                                   MEKUM Go ahead.

lines.text: I come to the old lady's funeral.

lines.speaker: u7714
lines.text: I don't believe I've seen you at any of our services before.

lines.speaker: u7715
lines.text: That's because I've been on the wagon.

lines.speaker: u7714
lines.text: PLEASE!

lines.speaker: u7715
lines.text: Where are they holding the wake? I'm supposed to be one of the pallbearers.

lines.speaker: u7714
lines.text: Show the gentleman to the chapel - pew number three.

lines.speaker: u7723
lines.text: Look, Chief - I better blow now, because if Spats Colombo sees me, it's Goodbye Charlie.

lines.speaker: u7715
lines.text: Goodbye, Charlie.

lines.speaker: u7718
lines.text: Hi, Spats.  We was laying eight to one you wouldn't show.

lines.speaker: u7720
lines.text: Why wouldn't I?

lines.speaker: u7718
lines.text: We thought you was all broken up about Toothpick Charlie.

lines.speaker: u7720
lines.text: Well, we all got to go sometime.

lines.speaker: u7718
lines.text: Yeah.  You never know who's going to be next.  Okay, Spats.  Report to the Sergeant- at-Arms.

lines.speaker: u7720
lines.text: What for?

lines.speaker: u7718
lines.text: Orders from Little Bonaparte.

lines.speaker: u7720
lines.text: Too bad, Charlie.  You would have had three eights.  Goodbye, Charlie!

lines.speaker: u7723
lines.text: No, Spats - no, no, no -  NO!

lines.speaker: u7727
lines.text: Does Kat know?

lines.speaker: u7725
lines.text: Jeffrey told her last night.

lines.speaker: u7727
lines.text: Last night?

lines.speaker: u7726
lines.text: Whats going on with you two?

lines.speaker: u7729
lines.text: I was pretty hard on her last night.  And now shes getting married.

lines.speaker: u7726
lines.text: Theres a reason I always tell that Tony Pee-Pants story, you know.

lines.speaker: u7729
lines.text: Trust me. This is bigger than Tony Pee-Pants.

lines.speaker: u7726
lines.text: Before Tony, you and your sister were best friends. I couldnt split you up. If your sister ate the spinach, you ate the spinach. If you threw up--.

lines.speaker: u7729
lines.text: Mom, please.

lines.speaker: u7726
lines.text: Anyway, when that boy came over, it was the first time you ever did anything without her.  And Amy wasnt just jealous...she was sad and lonely. She missed you.

lines.speaker: u7729
lines.text: She did?

lines.speaker: u7726
lines.text: So she flirted with Tony, and you got mad and sent him away. Who did that leave?  You and Amy. Reunited.

lines.speaker: u7728
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.speaker: u7727
lines.text: Doesnt look like nothing.

lines.speaker: u7729
lines.text: Im sorry?

lines.speaker: u7728
lines.text: I shagged Amy. Two years ago. Thats why I ended it. And then, after you left, sod it, we kept at it like rabbits until we both realized it was absolutely mad. And, you know, morally wrong. Then there was that one other time. And that was it.

lines.speaker: u7729
lines.text: Shes drunk. -er than me. But I didnt really dump you, did I?

lines.speaker: u7734
lines.text: Hard.

lines.speaker: u7733
lines.text: Hey, Sigmund, you think you could rustle up the bride and tell her to join the party?

lines.speaker: u7730
lines.text: Will do.

lines.speaker: u7735
lines.text: Clarence, would you tell us a story that was not true, after telling us it was?

lines.speaker: u7738
lines.text: No, Miss Johnson...

lines.speaker: u7735
lines.text: Can you swim?

lines.speaker: u7738
lines.text: Yes mam...

lines.speaker: u7736
lines.text: :--THE STRANGE ENDINGS OF NATURE THEY HAVE SEEN, MAY GIVE THE WORLD NEW POINTS OF VIEW AND MAKE THEIR LOVING, LIVING, AND DOING PRECIOUS TO ALL HUMAN...

lines.speaker: u7740
lines.text: :The night in the woods with his father and SOUNDER. The shouting and laughter after the baseball game --

lines.speaker: u7736
lines.text: :...HEARTS. AND TO THEMSELVES IN THESE DAYS THAT TRY THEIR SOULS...

lines.speaker: u7740
lines.text: :HE, JOSIE and EARL, running and playing in the field.

lines.speaker: u7736
lines.text: :...THE CHANCE TO SOAR IN THE DIM BLUE AIR ABOVE SMOKE IS TO THEIR...

lines.speaker: u7740
lines.text: :His visit with his father at the County Jail house --

lines.speaker: u7736
lines.text: :...FINER SPIRITS BOON AND GUERDON FOR WHAT THEY LOSE ON EARTH BY BEING BLACK.

lines.speaker: u7740
lines.text: :His mother, with her head thrown back, her eyes aglitter and laughing.

lines.speaker: u7737
lines.text: I see you found what you was lookin' for.

lines.speaker: u7747
lines.text: I did look, Charlie, but I--

lines.speaker: u7737
lines.text: No buts, Rita!

lines.speaker: u7747
lines.text: Charlie, you have no legal right not to let this boy know where his father is! You hear that, you and this whole damn court house; what you are doing is wrong!

lines.speaker: u7737
lines.text: Don't tell me about what's wrong. You come into my office as a friend and steal city files! I could have you arrested for that -- and if you give out that information to anybody, that's exactly what I'm going to do -- and I'll tell everybody in this town how you got the information and who you got it for! You won't have a friend left in this county to bring you a piece of candy!

lines.speaker: u7747
lines.text: You would do that, wouldn't you?

lines.speaker: u7737
lines.text: You getting the point, Mrs. Boatwright.

lines.speaker: u7747
lines.text: Hello, David...

lines.speaker: u7739
lines.text: Hi, Mrs. Boatwright...  I'm sorry 'bout the way I acted the other day, Miss Boatwright.

lines.speaker: u7748
lines.text: Hi ya doin' there, Ike?

lines.speaker: u7743
lines.text: Any time it's Saturday and I don't hafta do any work, I'm doin' okay!

lines.speaker: u7748
lines.text: Whatcha got there?

lines.speaker: u7743
lines.text: Seems this piece of mail came to Mr. Howard's place this mornin' and he had me to bring it over here.

lines.speaker: u7748
lines.text: Well, let me have it.

lines.speaker: u7743
lines.text: Don't belong to you! It's for the little important man, here!

lines.speaker: u7744
lines.text: Mama, what was we laughin' for?

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: At the way you ask funny questions, Josie Mae!

lines.speaker: u7745
lines.text: Hi ya, Rebecca...

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: Tired.

lines.speaker: u7745
lines.text: Somebody told me Nathan was back. How is he?

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: Why don't you pay him a visit, Mr. Howard? He'll tell you all about it.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: Where you goin'!?

lines.speaker: u7748
lines.text: To the commissary to get this boy some clothes! I'm gon' get everybody somethin'!

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: But, Nathan--

lines.speaker: u7748
lines.text: Don't tell me nothin' 'bout what we owe ol' man Howard! I'll do the owing, and let him worry 'bout the collecting! Come on, David Lee!

lines.speaker: u7749
lines.text: No, I ain't got no word yet, Rebecca. I went to the courthouse yesterday to see 'bout it, but they just won't tell me nothin' about what labor camp Nathan was sent to. I'm sorry, Rebecca.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: It's a shame, Reverend. It's a damn shame.

lines.speaker: u7749
lines.text: I hope you don't take to bitterness, Sister Morgan. I tell you like I tell all the women in this church who got the same trouble you got. No matter what the trial or what the misery is, I tell 'em to stay with God.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: Yeah, he'll crawl into my bed tonight, lie close to my body and keep me warm -- and rectify the evil in the men who live over us in this valley.

lines.speaker: u7749
lines.text: It's not that simple, Sister Rebecca -- the Lord works in mysterious ways -- we come into this life with nothin' and we'll leave it with nothing.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: Is that a blessing, Reverend?

lines.speaker: u7751
lines.text: Howya do, Rebecca. I sorta been expectin' you this mornin'.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: I wanta see Nathan.

lines.speaker: u7751
lines.text: I wish I could, Rebecca, but I can't let you.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: I don't understand that, Sheriff Young.

lines.speaker: u7751
lines.text: It's the rules and I gotta follow 'em. No visitin' 'cept holidays and Sunday -- and no womenfolk anytime.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: You mean to tell me I can't see my own husband?

lines.speaker: u7751
lines.text: That's the way they do things here in Landsdown. I just follow orders.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: I got to see my husband, Sheriff Young!

lines.speaker: u7751
lines.text: I'd like to help you, Rebecca. But all that would do, is git us both in trouble.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: Will they give him a trial?

lines.speaker: u7751
lines.text: Shore thing -- next week sometime, and as soon as I git the day, I'll ride out and let you know 'bout it.

lines.speaker: u7750
lines.text: You gotta low-life job, mister sheriff!

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: The clitoris?! I DID IT!! I FOUND THE CLITORIS!!

lines.speaker: u7752
lines.text: Stan, your friends need you. They are in trouble and you must help them.

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: Wait, you're supposed to tell me how to get Wendy to like me.

lines.speaker: u7752
lines.text: There are more important matters right now...

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: NO WAY, DUDE! I'VE LOOKED ALL OVER FOR YOU, AND NOW YOU HAVE TO TELL ME HOW TO GET WENDY TO LIKE ME!!

lines.speaker: u7752
lines.text: Dude, she's eight years old, just get her some ice cream or something.

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: Of COURSE!! Ice cream!!

lines.speaker: u7752
lines.text: Now go, your friends are in danger... The USO show is a mile east of here, just over that ridge. The clitoris has spoken.

lines.speaker: u7753
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u7762
lines.text: The Canadians are just mad that we mothers here in South Park have the chutzpah to stand up to them!  Like it or not, Mr. Canadian Minister, OUR children are now safe from your Canadian smut!

lines.speaker: u7764
lines.text: Wendy, Mkay, if you want to start getting political, I'll throw your skinny little butt right back into rehab. Mkay?

lines.speaker: u7754
lines.text: HOW THE FUCK CAN YOU NOT GRADUATE ME?! DOES THAT MEAN I HAVE TO STAY HERE?!

lines.speaker: u7764
lines.text: No, Eric... I'm afraid it's phase two for you...

lines.speaker: u7762
lines.text: Kyle?!

lines.speaker: u7755
lines.text: Eric?

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: Chef, what does it mean that we're at war?

lines.speaker: u7756
lines.text: It's... It's not good children.

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: WE'RE going! WE started La Resistance to save Terrance and Phillip! We're going!

lines.speaker: u7758
lines.text: This will be very dangerous... Are you quite sure?

lines.speaker: u7761
lines.text: Yes I am!

lines.speaker: u7759
lines.text: Baba mama!

lines.speaker: u7760
lines.text: Mrph?

lines.speaker: u7768
lines.text: I wouldn't bullshit you kid! Snacky Smores are now available in stores everywhere! No biggie!

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: Mom, I'm a man. Just a man. And I'm going to have fun with profanity just like you and dad did when you were little.

lines.speaker: u7761
lines.text: Yeah, so what if you say uncle raper or dicksucker or, or-

lines.speaker: u7764
lines.text: Mrs. Brovlofski, the V-chip hasn't been fully tested yet, it could be dangerous.

lines.speaker: u7762
lines.text: I don't care if it's dangerous! Desperate times call for desperate measures, Mr. Mackey. Perhaps I need to remind you of your situation.

lines.speaker: u7764
lines.text: Alright, I'll make the call...

lines.speaker: u7765
lines.text: You're quite a purveyor of filth, little boy!

lines.speaker: u7772
lines.text: Indeedy, that was a delicious choice of words!

lines.speaker: u7768
lines.text: Now do what I say and keep your fucking mouth shut!

lines.speaker: u7769
lines.text: THAT'S IT!  I HAVE HAD ENOUGH!!!!

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: Got it.

lines.speaker: u7773
lines.text: And ze rope?

lines.speaker: u7770
lines.text: Check.

lines.speaker: u7773
lines.text: And the butfor?

lines.speaker: u7788
lines.text: No, I think hygiene is important. It helps you get into the part.

lines.speaker: u7776
lines.text: Very professional of you.

lines.speaker: u7777
lines.text: Is that clear?

lines.speaker: u7784
lines.text: That's clear.

lines.speaker: u7777
lines.text: Good.  Now you'll hear from me when I have the new coordinates. In the meantime don't bug me.

lines.speaker: u7784
lines.text: Sheesh!  Aye aye cap'n!

lines.speaker: u7777
lines.text: Over and out!

lines.speaker: u7778
lines.text: It's getting hard to breathe...

lines.speaker: u7781
lines.text: Just don't move around too much.

lines.speaker: u7779
lines.text: I'm going back for Taylor!

lines.speaker: u7781
lines.text: Are you nuts!  It's too risky!

lines.speaker: u7780
lines.text: What the hell is that?

lines.speaker: u7781
lines.text: The engines!

lines.speaker: u7786
lines.text: Is it safe for human transport?

lines.speaker: u7782
lines.text: That's affirmative.

lines.speaker: u7789
lines.text: Did you hear about that bowler who got smeared? I saw them pull a body bag out of the alley. I heard he was kacked but good. They had to take apart the pin machine to get him out.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: The pin machine?

lines.speaker: u7789
lines.text: Just like Junior did the last time; lane six. All's I know is it's gonna be a closed coffin. My advice to you is to lay low. He puts on a pair of dark 7-Eleven shades, flips up his collar and skulks away.

lines.speaker: u7790
lines.text: You a mini-golfer?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Nope.

lines.speaker: u7790
lines.text: Paradise, huh? Might be one of the new putt-putts off route 99. Theo turns to leave.

lines.speaker: u7790
lines.text: Can I get you something for the road?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: You have orange whips?

lines.speaker: u7790
lines.text: Orange who? Not from 'round here, are ya?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: No. I'm from Akron.

lines.speaker: u7801
lines.text: The Faz sure took care a her.  Breeze makes a nasal GRUNT as he tries to suppress a snigger. Sid - trying to keep a straight face - elbows him. Sid and Breeze approach the coffin. Breeze pulls an orange whip out of a paper bag and carefully places it on the coffin lid.

lines.speaker: u7791
lines.text: Nectar of the bowling gods, Faz.

lines.speaker: u7801
lines.text: See ya 'round Faz.

lines.speaker: u7798
lines.text: My poor baby!

lines.speaker: u7792
lines.text: You see what you did?  Take your ball and get out.

lines.speaker: u7793
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Hello, mom?

lines.speaker: u7793
lines.text: Theodore? Where are you? Are you alright?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: I found dad.

lines.speaker: u7793
lines.text: He's dead, isn't he.  Buzz Fazeli might just as well have died before you were born.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Mom, you know I had to do it. I just did it a little too late.

lines.speaker: u7793
lines.text: You sure you're OK Teddy? You're not bowling are you?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: I gotta go. Love ya mom.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Don't tell me, John.

lines.speaker: u7794
lines.text: Cool!

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Theo. Howzitgoin.

lines.speaker: u7794
lines.text: Hey man, welcome to our parking lot. Lemme give you some advice, if she asks you to dance, make sure her brother's not around. Somebody blew out Junior's pilot light, if you get my meaning.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: How's that?

lines.speaker: u7794
lines.text: I was doing the lambada with her and the guy freaks, he breaks my arm, tries to kill me. I swear man, the guy thought I was a piata. If nobody else hadn't a been there, he wouldn't have stopped. He woulda killed me. Fuckin' guy man, just snapped. How do you like your burger?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Uh...over easy.

lines.speaker: u7794
lines.text: I'll tell you one thing, you won't see me around that alley with that freak on the loose. Stay away from his ass - and don't play any of his fuckin' knock-knock jokes.

lines.speaker: u7796
lines.text: I have someone for you to play with Junior.

lines.speaker: u7795
lines.text: Someone wants to play with me?

lines.speaker: u7796
lines.text: I have someone for you to play Blueface with Junior.

lines.speaker: u7795
lines.text: Blueface! Blueface is my favorite.

lines.speaker: u7796
lines.text: I get them while they're young. Builds loyalty.

lines.speaker: u7799
lines.text: She hit it, Mr. Kastle!

lines.speaker: u7796
lines.text: Four or five years when a girl like that's bowling on the pro tour for Team Kastle, she'll pay a handsome profit on my investment.

lines.speaker: u7797
lines.text: Hole in one! You're the queen of stroke!

lines.speaker: u7803
lines.text: Yippy!

lines.speaker: u7798
lines.text: Careful with that one. He won't tell me anything, but I know there's something strange going on over at the lanes. If you ask me, I'd say the old fart wants to die.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Where can I find him?

lines.speaker: u7798
lines.text: The Peter Pan.

lines.speaker: u7800
lines.text: Very professional.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: I am a professional man.

lines.speaker: u7800
lines.text: Lips still for sale?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: You bet. For five bucks, I'll even throw in the tongue.

lines.speaker: u7800
lines.text: Can you change something this big?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: You faked my dad's murder. You used him! Where is he! Theo chases Sid and Breeze around their car. He catches Sid and grabs the middle fingers on his right hand. Sid howls.

lines.speaker: u7801
lines.text: Ow! Ooh! No, please! Doc said I'd be back on the planks in a week! Show him Breeze! Breeze pulls a copy of "New York Bowler" from his pocket. The headline reads "RUB OUT!:BOWLING LEGEND KACKED BY DWARFSCAM KINGPIN" with a photo of Buzz Fazeli.

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: ... Your civil rights have been overridden!

lines.speaker: u7804
lines.text: Open it, Captain!

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: Dr. Levine, please!  Return to your seat!

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: Well, until we know exactly what it is, nobody goes outside, understood?

lines.speaker: u7814
lines.text: What was Edmunds doing outside?

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: Resetting the sub.

lines.speaker: u7814
lines.text: What sub?

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: In the dome hanger.  All our tapes are transferred to the sub.  It's on a 12 hour timer.  If someone doesn't reset the "delay" button, the sub ascends to the surface with the tapes.

lines.speaker: u7809
lines.text: They're going to want answers and they're going to keep asking until they get them.

lines.speaker: u7806
lines.text: We can refuse to talk.

lines.speaker: u7809
lines.text: Won't make any difference.  The tapes document everything.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: When did it come across?

lines.speaker: u7807
lines.text: Minutes ago.  Harry's trying to decode it in his room now.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: Where's it coming from?

lines.speaker: u7807
lines.text: No idea.  We have no surface support. It transmitted too fast to be coming from underwater.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: Is it coming from our own computer?

lines.speaker: u7807
lines.text: Harry thinks it's some sort of discharge from our own system, but I've seen it discharge before -- and it didn't look anything like this.

lines.speaker: u7814
lines.text: Don't gimme that psychology bullshit, Norman.  Psychology isn't a science, it's superstition.  It's a bunch of soft, subjective theories without any hard data to back it up. With an intellect like this, emotions don't mean shit.

lines.speaker: u7809
lines.text: It's like showing Leonardo da Vinci a laptop computer.  He'd run screaming "witchcraft".  And you couldn't explain it to him, either. Modems, microchips, particle physics.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: That whole time -- I couldn't stop thinking of what Harry was saying earlier...

lines.speaker: u7810
lines.text: What was that, sir?

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: About the time paradox.  How we were all going to die -- that there was no way we would make it out of here alive --

lines.speaker: u7815
lines.text: There's a U.S.  Navy car outside, Norman.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u7815
lines.text: Was it a military crash?

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: u7815
lines.text: They never used to send a Navy car.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: The Kiber Crystal.

lines.speaker: u7816
lines.text: Keep it with you always.  You'll have more need of it than I.  It will bring the Force to you.  You've already learned to feel it... Now you must learn to use it.

lines.speaker: u7817
lines.text: I'll tell you, Luke, and this is between you and me.  The star force isn't all it's cracked up to be. Frankly, it's a bore, and it's going to stay that way as long as this system is neutral...

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: But you always said things were so great at the academy... What happened?

lines.speaker: u7817
lines.text: The academy is fantastic... Of course, they won't teach you anything about flying you don't already know.  Most of the instructors are very conservative pilots.  You can fly circles around them... but there is a lot on the scientific side that is down-right amazing, and you get a lot of discipline... but after you graduate, don't join the star force -- go free-lance.  It's the only way to get into the action... I can't wait until my hitch is up.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: At least you're doing something... I'd give anything to be in your position.

lines.speaker: u7817
lines.text: Just be warned, that things aren't always as they seem... especially the starforce recruiting posters.

lines.speaker: u7818
lines.text: Blue Five, break off your cover attack.  It's too late.  Make your own run on the exhaust port.  Do you copy, Luke?

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: Yes, sir, but I can get him...

lines.speaker: u7818
lines.text: Forget it, son.

lines.speaker: u7819
lines.text: We don't get many visitors.  Let's take a look at it.

lines.speaker: u7820
lines.text: Send out a boarding party.  Full assault gear.

lines.speaker: u7821
lines.text: I noticed you were having some problems, Blue Five... I thought I'd help.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: Thanks, old buddy.  I'll be with you in a second.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: A Wookiee broke loose up here, but we've subdued him... There is a lot of damage, and three, no four, casualties...

lines.speaker: u7822
lines.text: We'll send a squad up.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: No need, everything's under control.

lines.speaker: u7822
lines.text: With four casualties?!

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: The... ah door's jammed.  Give us a few minutes to get it fixed.

lines.speaker: u7822
lines.text: Who is this?  What's your operating...

lines.speaker: u7823
lines.text: And you?

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: I... I don't know.  I guess I never thought about it... I just want to help.  I want to be in on the attack. I want my own ship.

lines.speaker: u7823
lines.text: If you're as good a pilot as you are a swordsman... We're the ones who have been rewarded.

lines.speaker: u7826
lines.text: Thank you, sir.  Your kindness is greatly appreciated, but if it's at all possible, Artoo and I would like to remain in your service.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: I'd consider it an honor.

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: Saddle up, Roughnecks !

lines.speaker: u7828
lines.text: You heard the Lieutenant ! On the bounce, troopers !

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: Sir, I wish to reconsider my request to drop out, sir.

lines.speaker: u7829
lines.text: Sorry, son. I can't do it. You signed the 1240/A. It would be illegal.

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: Sir, i know it was wrong. I didn't learn from one mistake and I made another, sir.  Sir, my family... my whole family was in Buenos Aires, sir.

lines.speaker: u7837

lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: u8099
lines.text: That Silberman just crack me up.  He had this guy in here last week who set his Afghan on fire. Screwed it first, then set it on--

lines.speaker: u8100
lines.text: Shut up.

lines.speaker: u8101
lines.text: Are you finished?

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: No.  This is my lawyer, Samuel Sutherland.  I thought you two should meet.

lines.speaker: u8101
lines.text: We met, this morning.  I signed the termination contract for Baer/Grace. I accepted your settlement, Nicholas. you were right.  I'm going sailing.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Did you play recently?

lines.speaker: u8102
lines.text: Hm?  No, about a year ago.  I was working out of Los Angeles.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: I've heard good things about their London branch.  You have to admit, it sounds like some fantasy, role-playing nonsense.

lines.speaker: u8102
lines.text: You want to know what it is?  What it's all about?  John.  Chapter nine.  Verse twenty-five.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: I, uh... haven't been to Sunday school in years...

lines.speaker: u8102
lines.text: "Whereas once I was blind, now I can see."  Night, Nick.  Best of luck.

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: I have to get to the airport...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Where are you going in such a hurry?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: There's another gig starting in Saudi Arabia.  I'm just a walk-on this time though.  Bit-part.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: What about dinner sometime, when you get back?  Would that be... ?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Is this something you're interested in?  I'm not really that person I was.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: I realize.  Maybe you could... tell me a little about yourself.

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Like what... my favorite color... ?

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Like... where are you from?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Originally, Connecticut.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Big family... small?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: One brother, one sister.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Studied acting, I assume?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Julliard, yeah.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Single?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Boyfriend?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Underwear?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Always.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: u8104
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Split it?

lines.speaker: u8104
lines.text: Oh, God yes please.  Thanks, man. I'll take you up on that.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Where's Christine?  The waitress.

lines.speaker: u8104
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.  She called a cab. Said something about catching a plane.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Did she?

lines.speaker: u8105
lines.text: How much is it?  A few thousand, at least.  A Rolex like that... lucky for you they missed it.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Yes, very lucky.

lines.speaker: u8106
lines.text: We have to head out... just wanted to say goodbye.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: You're going?  Well, thanks again.  Good to see you, Rachel...  Thanks for coming, Mel.  I'll get your car back.  Right now it's, uh... at the zoo.  Sorry.

lines.speaker: u8106
lines.text: Happy Birthday, Nicholas.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: I'll call.  I really will.

lines.speaker: u8106
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Where?

lines.speaker: u8107
lines.text: I told you, they hired me over the phone.  I never met anyone.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Where'd you pick up your checks?

lines.speaker: u8107
lines.text: It was a different floor then...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Guess!

lines.speaker: u8107
lines.text: Like, this way... sort of...

lines.speaker: u8108
lines.text: Isn't this what you like?  They told me you had a thing for boats.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: First they try to kill me, now you?  Put your damn clothes back on.

lines.speaker: u8109
lines.text: Show Mr. Van Orton to his room.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: The key?

lines.speaker: u8109
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Is there a room key?

lines.speaker: u8109
lines.text: Didn't I give you two?

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: No, you didn't...

lines.speaker: u8110
lines.text: Goodnight.  See you home.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Goodnight.  Where was she?

lines.speaker: u8112
lines.text: There were complaints by other guests, and damage to his room.  We did the best we could to accommodate his behavior.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: His behavior... ?

lines.speaker: u8112
lines.text: He couldn't, or refused to pay.  We extended credit...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Look, where is he?!

lines.speaker: u8112
lines.text: There was an incident a few days ago... a nervous breakdown, they said.  The police took him.  They left this address, in case anyone...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: "Under the Bleachers"... by Seymour Butts.

lines.speaker: u8113
lines.text: Pardon me?  I'm afraid I don't...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Cancel lunch.  Make reservations at Campton Place for me and Mr. Butts.

lines.speaker: u8116
lines.text: Bravo, young man.  you have to tell me what this was all about sometime.  I want you to know... when it looked there for awhile like you were going slowly insane... I was fully prepared to have you committed to the <u>finest</u> mental-health facility available.  I mean that sincerely, don't thank me.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: You warm my heart.

lines.speaker: u8124
lines.text: Nell!

lines.speaker: u8117
lines.text: We can't stay here looking for her.  She doesn't want to be found...

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: Why are you working with her? Mary Lambretta was thrown out of the department for trying to get a Ph.D. in psychic studies.

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: And after she was thrown out, she needed a job.

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: You don't believe in the paranormal.

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: No, but she does, and that's all that matters.

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: Does she know that's why you're using her?

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: I, I just can't...

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: She needed a job, Malcolm.  And she's smart.  And she helps me.

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: I have a bad feeling about what you're doing.

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: This is the last chapter.  Please, please give me clearance.  It's for science.

lines.speaker: u8124
lines.text: I'm not going back to New York City.  I'm going to find an apartment with a little flower garden, where you can just see the ocean and at night, when the wind comes in just right, you can hear the sound of the harbor.  What about you?

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: I'm a scientist.  I just conducted an experiment.  Now I have to write it up.

lines.speaker: u8124
lines.text: But the experiment was a failure.

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u8121
lines.text: Why'd she kill herself?

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8121
lines.text: She was unhappy.

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u8121
lines.text: Can't say.  Haven't been here that long.  Well, it's Labor Day, gotta get to work.

lines.speaker: u8122
lines.text: No one could.  No one lives any nearer than town.

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: No one will come any nearer than that.

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: Oh, Theo.  You know I don't have an apartment.

lines.speaker: u8124
lines.text: Then let's go get you one.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u8126
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: Because --

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: Where do <u>you</u> think he is, Mike.

lines.speaker: u8127
lines.text: We'll find him.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: No.  I mean.  Not even your people should be involved.  Right?  It's too close now.

lines.speaker: u8127
lines.text: You could use a few of my prime shitkickers up here.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: You think I'm staying?

lines.speaker: u8127
lines.text: There's already gonna be talk about how people close to you keep falling into canyons.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: Well, can we make it one more.  Nowhere the fuck near me.

lines.speaker: u8128
lines.text: You broke last time.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: Let him break - he likes to break.

lines.speaker: u8128
lines.text: Fuck you.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: I wouldn't talk.

lines.speaker: u8128
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: I saw your mother on the Strip last night.  She went up to three guys, said she'd like 'em to stick one in each, know what I mean?

lines.speaker: u8130
lines.text: CQ what?

lines.speaker: u8129
lines.text: Close Quarters Combat.  Keep one in my own home.

lines.speaker: u8130
lines.text: I thought maybe you just came for the ride.

lines.speaker: u8131
lines.text: I'd rather be with him than without him. I don't want to be found dead in L.A.

lines.speaker: u8131
lines.text: You're just on a higher plane, Wilson.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Too bleeding true, 'n' it.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: There's one thing I don't understand.  The thing I don't understand ... is every motherfucking thing you're saying.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Look, mush, you're the guv'nor here, I can see that, I'm on your manor now, right.  So there's no need to get out of your pram.  I'm Johnny-come-lately to all this.  Whatever the bollocks between you and this slag Valentine, it's got nothing to do with me.  I don't wanna know.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: Well, I'll tell you.  I believe this Valentine screwed me out of a fair sum of money.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: I can well believe it.  I'm sure he has done, son.  He's about as straight as a dog's hind leg.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: But I can't be sure.  I don't even know who he is.  He's too insulated.  Too many layers around him.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Your guess is as good as mine, mate.  I'm here on another matter entirely.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: Yeah, I guess you are.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Good job your lot showed up when they did or it would've been <u>me</u> for the high jump.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: That dude who works for Valentine.  He's the one sent those guys after you.  You know that.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Yeah.  Shouldn't wonder.  Must've done.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: So what's your beef, pal?

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Nothing financial.  Strictly personal.  I can see how all this import-export malarkey might give rise to confusion where I'm concerned.  A foreigner, showing up unexpectedly, like.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: It was you.  Downtown.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Eh?

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: Because that wasn't anything to do with me.  And suspicion has been cast in my direction.  Didn't make any sense.  Choosing those shitheads over me, cutting me out of the deal, then screwing them over too.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: No, I can reassure you on that point. Valentine was just as surprised by that turn of events as you.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: He'd already grabbed more than his allotted cut.  Didn't think he'd be so bold as to take all of it.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: All of what?

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: Of the deal, man.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Oh, yeah, right.  The deal.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: But if you're mad at him too and he's mad at you ... that must make us pals.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: As you prefer, squire.  As you prefer.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: In which case I'll just do what I usually do.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: And that is?

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: What am I doing?

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: Valentine had himself a party, I hear.

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: My client has already given a statement regarding yesterday's events.

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: A <u>statement</u>?  I wouldn't mind getting a statement.  You see, <u>my</u> client -- the United States Government -- would love to get a statement about a few of the deals going down with your client.

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: Deals?  My client is involved in any number of deals at any given moment. You'd have to be more specific.

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: Your client have a deal in Long Beach? How about downtown?  There's some folks there -- oh, wait, they're all dead.  Any of this ring a bell?

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: My client is an entrepreneur.  I am his lawyer, not his business manager.

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: So you wouldn't have any idea how your client continues to make so much fucking money.

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: He's always been very forward-thinking. He invested wisely.

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: Where is he now?

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: He had urgent business in the north.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: Don't you work with Ian?

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Ian?

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: I could swear I met you with Ian at the EMI offices in London.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Sorry.  Wasn't me.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: You sure?

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Unless I'm not who I think I am.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: That's too bad.  Ian's got a good thing going over there.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: Turned that place completely around.  180 degrees.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: No kidding.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: What I like about Ian, he believes in a chain of command, but not a chain of respect, you understand what I'm saying?

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Right.  Chain of respect.  That's good, that.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: Yeah.  I really admire the guy.  Well. Good to meet you.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Yeah.  Cheers, mate.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: But first I gotta give these lads a talking to, these geezers what sent me up the river, in a manner of speaking.

lines.speaker: u8136
lines.text: The ones whose burden you took upon your own shoulders.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: We coulda used the other two-and-a-half grand.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: There's more than a measly few grand in this.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: There is?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: Something's on.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: I happen to know more about Mr. Whatever- his-name-is than he thinks I know about him and his operation.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: You do?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: You bet.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: Like what.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: Like he'd never hire me for real.  Not week-to-week.  I don't have the credentials.  He thinks I'm just a sociopath, someone he can turn to when he needs "plausible denial."

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: Well, we blew it, didn't we?  He ain't wrong.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: "He ain't wrong."  Listen, I know this asshole who <u>did</u> just go to work for him. Full-time.  And this dickhead's parents just told me he took a road trip up the coast.  <u>That's</u> the type of individual gets hired, someone who'll shoot his mouth off to his family while on the job.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: I don't get it.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: I don't know who that English guy is. Some kind of --  -- courier or something.  Maybe a seller. Maybe a buyer.  But Mr. <u>Avery</u> wanted him, those jigs wanted him -- and I betcha there's a briefcase somewhere.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: What's in it?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: Drugs?  Cash?  Both if we're lucky.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: How we gonna get that lucky?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: While they're all fucking each other over ... couple of parties like us could move right in.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Where is he, then?

lines.speaker: u8138
lines.text: Listen, get the fuck out of here before you get hurt.  Who the fuck do you think you are, waltzing in here, asking questions?

lines.speaker: u8139
lines.text: It's been five minutes and I'm packing to leave again.  I can't believe this.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: That's right, your life is Shit, and I'm to blame.  It's that simple.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: She could've had the deal!  I would've handed it to her if she wanted.  I would have given her everything.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: <u>Why</u> then.  Why did you do it!

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...Yes?

lines.speaker: u8143
lines.text: At night, there were lights--we both saw them. We never told anyone, outside of our official report.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Ann--

lines.speaker: u8143
lines.text: A spacecraft. I saw the creatures. They led Big Dave onto the craft. He never told anyone what they did, outside of his report. Of course he told *me*. No one else.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Ann--

lines.speaker: u8143
lines.text: The government knows. I cannot repeat it to you. But this thing goes deep, Ed. This was not your wife. I goes deep, and involves the government. There is a great deal of fear. You know how certain circles would find it--the knowledge--a threat. They try to limit it, and--

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Ann, will you come in, sit down, maybe have a drink?

lines.speaker: u8143
lines.text: Sometimes knowledge is a curse, Ed. After this happened, things changed. Big Dave... he never touched me again.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...No, please.

lines.speaker: u8144
lines.text: Please, Mr Crane, it's OK, please--

lines.speaker: u8145
lines.text: ...she can go up there.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Well, look, I don't claim to be an expert--

lines.speaker: u8145
lines.text: Then you listen to me, for I am expert. That girl, she give me a headache. She cannot play. Nice girl. Very clever hands. Nice girl. Someday, I think, maybe, she make a very good typist.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...You're not gonna screw me on this?

lines.speaker: u8146
lines.text: *Screw* you--Jesus! Take it to a lawyer! No, I insist! This is *dry* cleaning, this is not some fly-by- night thing here! I must say, I've been an entrepreneur for thirteen years and I've never--

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: u8146
lines.text: And I've never been asked--Look, you want the dough back? You know who I am! You--

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: OK.

lines.speaker: u8147
lines.text: ...What kind of man *are* you?

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...Huh?

lines.speaker: u8147
lines.text: What kind of man *are* you?

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Big Dave--

lines.speaker: u8147
lines.text: I'd understand if you'd walked in here. Socked me in the nose. Whatever. I deserved it.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: I, uh...

lines.speaker: u8147
lines.text: I'm not proud of what I did. But *you*.

lines.speaker: u8148
lines.text: ...Hell, I hope I've done the right thing.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: My wife and I had not... performed the sex act in many years.
